metadata.title: CVE-2014-1859 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
(1) core/tests/test_memmap.py, (2) core/tests/test_multiarray.py, (3)f2py/f2py2e.py, and (4) lib/tests/test_io.py in NumPy before 1.8.1 allowlocal users to write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a temporaryfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-numpy - 1:1.8.1~rc1-1
python3-numpy - 1:1.8.1~rc1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-numpy package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.8.1~rc1-1').
